intro: Taraktogenos heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf taraktogenos, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to lanceolate depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a resilient species in its native habitat.
